most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Authentication and Database Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with login and database corruption after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0. Authentication issues were resolved with a hotfix. Database problems were linked to missing AVX2 support and fixed in version 11.3.2. Users facing similar issues should update to the latest version or provide detailed logs for support.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Authentication Error on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Problem:** User `utrack` is experiencing authentication issues on Linux.
* **Timeline:** Issue reported on April 17, 2025.
* **Impact:** User is unable to access Pieces services due to authentication failure.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Authentication Error:** User is stuck at the authentication screen (https://authentication.pieces.services/).
* **Insufficient Information:** Initial log files provided by the user didn't contain enough information for troubleshooting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Pieces Support Bot:** Suggested related issues and resources for initial troubleshooting.
* **Support Engineer (Nathan Courtney):** Requested detailed logs and information about the user's Linux environment.
* **User Action:** User provided requested logs and confirmed their Linux distribution (Arch Linux).
* **Status:** Support engineer likely analyzing the logs to identify the root cause of the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open and under investigation.
* The support engineer will likely provide further updates or request additional information from the user.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user offered to enable debug logs, which may be helpful for further troubleshooting.
* The provided logs are attached to the issue for reference.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Authentication Issues in Pieces OS

**Key points raised:**

* Users were unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* The authentication process got stuck on `https://authentication.pieces.services/` when trying to login with Google or GitHub.
* Users attempted login from both Pieces desktop app and Pieces toolbar.
* This issue seemed to affect Windows 11 users specifically.

**Problems identified:**

* An issue in the new authentication pipeline introduced in version 11.3.0 was causing login attempts to hang indefinitely.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team investigated the issue and identified the problem.
* A fix was deployed within a few hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The authentication issue is resolved and users should be able to link their accounts successfully.

**Additional notes:**

* Users who continue to face issues after the update are advised to provide support logs.

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons

<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* New user Antoine79 is experiencing issues with their database on startup.
* After uninstalling and deleting the application folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* The initial bootup of the database is failing.
* Potential database corruption.
* The user's processor lacks AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Logging improvements implemented in version 11.3.1.
* Manual creation of missing folder by the user.
* Identification of the core issue (lack of AVX2 support).
* Release of version 11.3.2 with a fix for the identified issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been fixed in version 11.3.2, which is now live.
* The issue is closed as resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's understanding of the issue helped pinpoint the core problem.
* The development team was responsive and provided updates throughout the process.

common_issues.title: Authentication Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with account linking and login failures, particularly after updating to version 11.3.0. The authentication process would get stuck, resulting in an error or infinite loading. The Pieces team identified issues in the authentication pipeline and deployed fixes. Users facing persistent problems were advised to provide support logs for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The current account linking process is not user-friendly and needs improvement.
* The user, johnkennyuk, has two accounts (GitHub and Google) and wants to merge them with their personal domain set on the Google account as the main one.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking process is not straightforward and requires a manual intervention.
* There was a capitalization issue with the email address, preventing the accounts from merging.
* The user accidentally linked their accounts in the wrong order with the new auth system.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support team offered to manually merge the accounts.
* The support team reset the user's GitHub account multiple times.
* The user was advised to temporarily disable email privacy setting on their GitHub account.
* The user was advised to wait for the new authentication system to be implemented.
* The new authentication system was implemented and the user was able to successfully link their accounts.
* The user accidentally linked their accounts in the wrong order and needs them reset again.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has successfully linked their accounts with the new authentication system, but in the wrong order.
* The user is waiting for the support team to reset their accounts so they can link them again in the correct order.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication system is still under development and is expected to be released in early/mid March.
* The support team will reach out to the user when the new system is ready for use.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Authentication Error:** User is stuck at the authentication screen (https://authentication.pieces.services/).

**Additional Notes:**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report "Invalid Port" errors during Pieces Desktop launch and Pieces OS startup failures due to database corruption or missing dependencies. Proposed solutions include running installers with elevated permissions, ensuring AVX2 processor support, and reinstalling Pieces OS. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and improving documentation.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* SherlockSol reported an "Invalid Port" issue with Pieces Desktop.
* nathan-courtney-pieces requested log files and hardware information.
* SherlockSol provided log files and Build number.
* mack-at-pieces suggested troubleshooting via video call. 
* uzaxirr reported facing the same issue (April 11th).
* zedevmed found a fix by installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop with WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.

**Problems Identified:**

* "Invalid Port" issue during Pieces Desktop launch.
* Possible cause: insufficient permissions during installation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* SherlockSol provided log files and hardware information.
* Video call troubleshooting was suggested.
* zedevmed successfully resolved the issue using WinGet and elevated permissions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* zedevmed's solution appears to be effective. 
* Pieces team will adjust documentation and promote the MSIX or winget installation method to ensure proper permissions. 
* Issue remains open for further investigation and potential solution implementation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates ongoing efforts by the Pieces team to identify the root cause and provide a permanent solution.
* SherlockSol and uzaxirr will likely benefit from the proposed solution and updated documentation.

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* New user Antoine79 is experiencing issues with their database on startup.
* After uninstalling and deleting the application folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* The initial bootup of the database is failing.
* Potential database corruption.
* The user's processor lacks AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Logging improvements implemented in version 11.3.1.
* Manual creation of missing folder by the user.
* Identification of the core issue (lack of AVX2 support).
* Release of version 11.3.2 with a fix for the identified issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been fixed in version 11.3.2, which is now live.
* The issue is closed as resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's understanding of the issue helped pinpoint the core problem.
* The development team was responsive and provided updates throughout the process.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Authentication Error on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Problem:** User `utrack` is experiencing authentication issues on Linux.
* **Timeline:** Issue reported on April 17, 2025.
* **Impact:** User is unable to access Pieces services due to authentication failure.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Authentication Error:** User is stuck at the authentication screen (https://authentication.pieces.services/).
* **Insufficient Information:** Initial log files provided by the user didn't contain enough information for troubleshooting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Pieces Support Bot:** Suggested related issues and resources for initial troubleshooting.
* **Support Engineer (Nathan Courtney):** Requested detailed logs and information about the user's Linux environment.
* **User Action:** User provided requested logs and confirmed their Linux distribution (Arch Linux).
* **Status:** Support engineer likely analyzing the logs to identify the root cause of the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still open and under investigation.
* The support engineer will likely provide further updates or request additional information from the user.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user offered to enable debug logs, which may be helpful for further troubleshooting.
* The provided logs are attached to the issue for reference.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption on both macOS and Windows. The issue seems to be linked to specific versions (11.0.0, 11.3.0, EAP) and potentially related to plugin integration or missing AVX2 support. Proposed solutions included updating to the latest version (11.3.2), checking for similar issues (#686), and contacting support.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


\
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key points raised:**
* User @moazzem-pixel reports application crashing issue
* macOS 12.3, MacBook Air (2022), M2 machine
* Plugin A, Plugin B, Plugin C installed
* Crash logs and error messages attached
* Previous version (10.9.5) worked fine
* Expected behavior: application should launch without crashing

**Problems identified:**
* Application crashes on launch
* Potential link to a similar issue reported in #686

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* @mark-at-pieces suggested checking #686 for similar issue
* Offered to schedule a support call
* Proposed updating to the latest version 11.3.2

**Current status/outcome:**
* Resolved by updating to version 11.3.2
* User instructed to reopen the ticket if the issue persists after update

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* New user Antoine79 is experiencing issues with their database on startup.
* After uninstalling and deleting the application folder, the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* The initial bootup of the database is failing.
* Potential database corruption.
* The user's processor lacks AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Logging improvements implemented in version 11.3.1.
* Manual creation of missing folder by the user.
* Identification of the core issue (lack of AVX2 support).
* Release of version 11.3.2 with a fix for the identified issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been fixed in version 11.3.2, which is now live.
* The issue is closed as resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's understanding of the issue helped pinpoint the core problem.
* The development team was responsive and provided updates throughout the process.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @moazzem-pixel reported an issue related to Pieces OS database corruption.
* The user mentioned the issue prevented Pieces OS from starting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS was unable to open the database due to corruption.
* This resulted in the OS failing to start.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another existing issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).
* The user suggested continuing the conversation on the original issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was recognized as a duplicate and the user was directed to the original issue for further discussion.

**Note:**

* The conversation only includes responses from the Pieces support bot and @mark-at-pieces. 
* It's unclear if the user acknowledged the response or continued the conversation.

recommendations: **Prioritize Authentication Issues:** Investigate and address the root causes of authentication issues, particularly those related to account linking and login failures after the 11.3.0 update. This will directly impact a large number of users and improve their onboarding experience.

**Improve Database Stability:** Address the recurring issue of database corruption on startup, which affects both macOS and Windows users. Investigate potential links to specific versions, plugin integration, and AVX2 support to provide a permanent solution.

**Enhance Launch Procedures:** Provide clearer instructions and documentation for Pieces Desktop and Pieces OS installation, emphasizing the importance of elevated permissions and addressing "Invalid Port" errors. This will prevent similar issues for new users.

**Review AVX2 Dependency:** Evaluate the necessity of AVX2 support for Pieces OS, considering its impact on older hardware. Explore alternative solutions or provide clear communication to users regarding system requirements.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about ongoing issues, especially those impacting core functionalities like authentication and database stability. Provide updates on fixes, workarounds, and estimated resolution times to manage expectations and reduce support tickets.

**Analyze Support Trends:** Regularly analyze support tickets to identify recurring issues, common pain points, and areas for improvement in the software or documentation. This will help prioritize development efforts and enhance user experience over time.

**Automated Troubleshooting:** Explore options for automated troubleshooting within the Pieces Desktop application. This could include built-in diagnostics, log file analysis, and potential solutions for common issues, reducing the need for manual support intervention.

**User Feedback Mechanisms:** Implement a system for gathering user feedback directly within the application. This could include bug reporting tools, feature requests, and satisfaction surveys to proactively identify and address user pain points.
